summary:
NASCAR, short for National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing, is a big deal in the world of motorsports. Founded in 1948 by Bill France Sr., it's an American company that organizes over 1,500 races yearly, with its main events in the US but also in other countries. The races are divided into three main series, with Chevrolet, Ford, and Toyota as top competitors.

Stock car racing has its history tied to moonshine runners from the Prohibition era. NASCAR's roots began in North Carolina, with Bill France Sr. successfully organizing races in Daytona Beach. The sport has grown, now led by Jim France, and attracts drivers and fans from around the world. Richard Petty is a legend, holding the record for most Cup Series wins.
title: NASCAR
